title: nf-core/pcgr pipeline parameters
description: Downstream variant prioritisation using PCGR/CSPR designed to work off nf-core/sarek outputs

global_options.title: Global options
global_options.description: High level parameters for both PCGR and CSPR

genome.description: Genome assembly used to generate VCF files.
genome.help_text: PCGR works on outputs of Sarek and as such, this parameter simply denotes the genome assembly build used (GRCh37/GRCh38). The workflow does not download any reference files from iGenomes.

database.help_text: The workflow is designed to use docker containers containing the data bundle (default parameter). In the event you use the workflow with conda, you will need to download the data bundle manually and specify its path using this parameter.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to valid samplesheet CSV file. Please refer to documentation for valid samplesheet examples.
input.help_text: PCGR is designed to work on the outputs of Sarek. The simplest method is to point to the 'results/variant_calling/<tool>' directory generated by Sarek. Alternatively, you may wish to run PCGR on multiple tool outputs in which case a CSV file is preferred.

save_intermediates.description: Save tabixed, bgzipped and reformatted VCF files from a run?

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

pcgr_options.title: PCGR options
pcgr_options.description: Parameters specific to PCGR somatic reports

assay.description: Type of DNA sequencing assay performed for input data (VCF) default: WES

cpsr_report.description: CPSR report file (Gzipped JSON - file ending with 'cpsr.<genome_assembly>.json.gz' -  germline report of patient's blood/control sample

fasta.description: Reference fasta file used in Sarek analysis.
fasta.help_text: Used to normalize variants using bcftools, does not have to be indexed. Check your chromosome ID's against your VCF files (chr1 vs. 1)

tumor_site.description: Optional integer code to specify primary tumor type/site of query sample
tumor_site.help_text:
choose any of the following identifiers:
0 = Any, 1 = Adrenal Gland, 2 = Ampulla of Vater, 3 = Biliary Tract, 4 = Bladder/Urinary Tract, 5 = Bone, 6 = Breast, 7 = Cervix, 8 = CNS/Brain, 9 = Colon/Rectum, 10 = Esophagus/Stomach, 11 = Eye, 12 = Head and Neck, 13 = Kidney, 14 = Liver, 15 = Lung, 16 = Lymphoid, 17 = Myeloid, 18 = Ovary/Fallopian Tube, 19 = Pancreas, 20 = Peripheral Nervous System, 21 = Peritoneum, 22 = Pleura, 23 = Prostate, 24 = Skin, 25 = Soft Tissue, 26 = Testis, 27 = Thymus, 28 = Thyroid, 29 = Uterus, 30 = Vulva/Vagina,

cna_analysis.description: Include somatic copy number alteration analysis.
cna_analysis.help_text: The workflow will automatically parse Sarek CNA tools for compatibility with PCGR. Specify the file paths in your samplesheet using the column 'cna'.

logr_gain.description: Log ratio-threshold (minimum) for segments containing copy number gains/amplifications (default: 0.8)

logr_homdel.description: Log ratio-threshold (maximum) for segments containing homozygous deletions (default: -0.8)

cna_overlap_pct.description: Mean percent overlap between copy number segment and gene transcripts for reporting of gains/losses in tumor suppressor genes/oncogenes, (default: 50)

target_size_mb.description: For mutational burden analysis - approximate protein-coding target size in Mb of sequencing assay (default: 34 WGS/WES)

estimate_tmb.description: Estimate tumor mutational burden from the total number of somatic mutations and target region size, default: False

estimate_msi_status.description: Predict microsatellite instability status from patterns of somatic mutations/indels, default: False

tmb_algorithm.description: Method for calculation of TMB, all coding variants (Chalmers et al., Genome Medicine, 2017), or non-synonymous variants only, default: all_coding

estimate_signatures.description: Estimate relative contributions of reference mutational signatures in query sample and detect potential kataegis events, default: False

min_mutations_signatures.description: Minimum number of SNVs required for reconstruction of mutational signatures (SBS) by MutationalPatterns (default: 200, minimum n = 100)

all_reference_signatures.description: Use all reference mutational signatures (SBS, n = 67) in signature reconstruction rather than only those already attributed to the tumor type (default: False)

include_artefact_signatures.description: Include sequencing artefacts in the collection of reference signatures (default: False)

prevalence_reference_signatures.description: Minimum tumor-type prevalence (in percent) of reference signatures to be included in refitting procedure (default: 5)

include_trials.description: Include relevant ongoing or future clinical trials, focusing on studies with molecularly targeted interventions

tumor_dp_tag.description: Specify VCF INFO tag for sequencing depth (tumor, must be Type=Integer, default: TDP)
tumor_dp_tag.help_text: The workflow attempts to automatically assign new VCF info and header fields denoting the sequencing depth for the tumor sample with the TDP tag.

tumor_af_tag.description: Specify VCF INFO tag for variant allelic fraction (tumor,  must be Type=Float, default: TAF)
tumor_af_tag.help_text: The workflow attempts to automatically assign new VCF info and header fields denoting the variant allelic fraction for the tumor sample with the TAF tag.

control_dp_tag.description: Specify VCF INFO tag for sequencing depth (control, must be Type=Integer, default: NDP)
control_dp_tag.help_text: The workflow attempts to automatically assign new VCF info and header fields denoting the sequencing depth for the normal sample with the NDP tag.

control_af_tag.description: Specify VCF INFO tag for variant allelic fraction (control, must be Type=Float, default: NAF)
control_af_tag.help_text: The workflow attempts to automatically assign new VCF info and header fields denoting the variant allelic fraction for the normal sample with the NAF tag.

call_conf_tag.description: Specify VCF INFO tag for somatic variant call confidence (must be categorical, e.g. Type=String, default: _NA_)
call_conf_tag.help_text: BETA: the workflow will attempt to determine consensus calls of variants i.e mutect2,freebayes,strelka denotes the variant was called by three tools.

tumor_dp_min.description: If VCF INFO tag for sequencing depth (tumor) is specified and found, set minimum required depth for inclusion in report (default: 0)

tumor_af_min.description: If VCF INFO tag for variant allelic fraction (tumor) is specified and found, set minimum required AF for inclusion in report (default: 0)

control_dp_min.description: If VCF INFO tag for sequencing depth (control) is specified and found, set minimum required depth for inclusion in report (default: 0)

control_af_max.description: If VCF INFO tag for variant allelic fraction (control) is specified and found, set maximum tolerated AF for inclusion in report (default: 1)

pcgr_tumor_only_options.title: PCGR (Tumor-only) options
pcgr_tumor_only_options.description: Parameters specific to PCGR tumor only mode.

tumor_only.description: Input VCF comes from tumor-only sequencing, calls will be filtered for variants of germline origin, (default: False)

cell_line.description: Input VCF comes from tumor cell line sequencing (requires --tumor_only), calls will be filtered for variants of germline origin, (default: False)

pon_vcf.description: VCF file with germline calls from Panel of Normals (PON) - i.e. blacklisted variants, (default: None)

exclude_pon.description: Exclude variants occurring in PoN (Panel of Normals, if provided as VCF (--pon_vcf), default: False)

exclude_likely_hom_germline.description: Exclude likely homozygous germline variants (100 pct allelic fraction for alternate allele in tumor, very unlikely somatic event, default: False)

exclude_likely_het_germline.description: Exclude likely heterozygous germline variants (40-60 pct allelic fraction, AND presence in dbSNP + gnomAD, AND not existing as somatic event in COSMIC/TCGA, default: False)

exclude_dbsnp_nonsomatic.description: Exclude variants found in dbSNP (only those that are NOT found in ClinVar(somatic origin)/DoCM/TCGA/COSMIC, defult: False)

maf_onekg_eur.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project - European pop, default: 0.002)

maf_onekg_amr.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project - Ad mixed American pop, default: 0.002)

maf_onekg_afr.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project - African pop, default: 0.002)

maf_onekg_eas.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project -East Asian pop, default: 0.002)

maf_onekg_sas.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project - South Asian pop, default: 0.002)

maf_onekg_global.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold (1000 Genomes Project - Global pop, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_nfe.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - European (non-Finnish), default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_asj.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - Ashkenazi Jewish, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_fin.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - European (Finnish), default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_oth.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - Other, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_amr.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - Latino/Admixed American, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_afr.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - African/African-American, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_eas.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - East Asian, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_sas.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - South Asian, default: 0.002)

maf_gnomad_global.description: Exclude variants in tumor (SNVs/InDels, tumor-only mode) with MAF above the given percent threshold, (gnomAD - global population, default: 0.002)

cspr_options.title: CSPR options
cspr_options.description: Parameters specific to CPSR germline reports

panel_id.description: Select the virtual gene panel for cancer predisposition reports.
panel_id.help_text:
Virtual panels derived from Genomics England PanelApp see https://sigven.github.io/cpsr/articles/virtual_panels.html for more information.

N.B: Only used with --mode 'CPSR'

diagnostic_grade_only.description: For panel_id's 1-42 (Genomics England PanelApp) - consider genes with a GREEN status only, default: False

ignore_noncoding.description: Do not list non-coding variants in HTML report, default: False

pop_gnomad.description: Population source in gnomAD used for variant frequency assessment (ACMG classification), default: nfe

maf_upper_threshold.description: Upper MAF limit (gnomAD global population frequency) for variants to be included in the report, default: 0.9

classify_all.description: Provide CPSR variant classifications (TIER 1-5) also for variants with exising ClinVar classifications in output TSV, default: False

clinvar_ignore_noncancer.description: Ignore (exclude from report) ClinVar-classified variants reported only for phenotypes/conditions NOT related to cancer, default: False

vcf_filtering.title: VCF filtering
vcf_filtering.description: Pass a valid filtering expression to bcftools filter.
vcf_filtering.help_text:
Apply a filtering expression of your choice to each germline/somatic VCF file. 

Examples of valid filtering expressions are available here: https://samtools.github.io/bcftools/howtos/filtering.html

NB: escape double quotes in the filtering expression with a backslash.

filter_deepvariant.description: Apply filtering expression to DeepVariant VCF (germline) using bcftools filter.

filter_freebayes_germline.description: Apply filtering expression to FreeBayes (germline) using bcftools filter.

filter_freebayes_somatic.description: Apply filtering expression to FreeBayes (somatic) using bcftools filter.

filter_haplotypecaller.description: Apply filtering expression to GATK HaplotypeCaller (germline) using bcftools filter.

filter_mutect2.description: Apply filtering expression to GATK Mutect2 (somatic) using bcftools filter.

filter_strelka_indels.description: Apply filtering expression to Illumina Strelka Indels (somatic) using bcftools filter.

filter_strelka_snvs.description: Apply filtering expression to Illumina Strelka snvs (somatic) using bcftools filter.

filter_strelka_variants.description: Apply filtering expression to Illumina Strelka (germline) using bcftools filter.

vep_options.title: VEP options
vep_options.description: VEP parameters used for both PCGR and CPSR

vep_n_forks.description: Number of forks (option '--fork' in VEP), default: 4

vep_buffer_size.description: Variant buffer size (variants read into memory simultaneously, option '--buffer_size' in VEP). Set to lower to reduce memory usage, default: 500

vep_gencode_all.description: Consider all GENCODE transcripts with Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) (option '--gencode_basic' in VEP is used by default).

vep_pick_order.description: Comma-separated string of ordered transcript properties for primary variant pick                     ( option '--pick_order' in VEP), default: canonical,appris,biotype,ccds,rank,tsl,length,mane

vep_no_intergenic.description: Skip intergenic variants during processing (option '--no_intergenic' in VEP), default: False

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

enable_conda.description: Run this workflow with Conda. You can also use '-profile conda' instead of providing this parameter.
